title: The Garen buffs are much appreciated
body:
Greetings Summoners!

As a Garen main, there were two things I felt Garen was lacking in. First: He was not good enough at punishing the enemies of Demacia. They are villainous scum who deserve no mercy. Second: He was not good enough at surviving the attacks of said villainous scum. While one should always be willing to give one's life for the Glory of Demacia, it is far better to make the enemy give *their* life for Demacia instead. 

Well, while subtle, the buffs to judgement are appreciated. I usually like to build a hybrid of tank and damage on Garen, with {{item:3071}} being essential, and {{item:3026}} and {{item:3812}} being preferred in most games unless I fall behind. And the buffs to his passive combined with health regain masteries really give him wonderful levels of sustain. He only needs to recall if he is dead or has too much gold. One can not bully him out of lane anymore!

But the biggest and most appreciated buff is definitely the buff to courage. It is one of the most satisfying things in the game when the enemy tosses all their CC at you, but Garen shrugs it off like the righteous badass he is. Plus the counter that shows how much damage was reduced is surprisingly nice. I didn't think it would matter, but it makes the ability more satisfying to use. 

So in conclusions, 
#DEMACIA!

http://i.imgur.com/W0wVY4c.gif[/img]

old dance was better rip

why are you building death's dance and not glorious, beautiful lethality?

{{item:3142}} {{item:3147}} {{champion:86}}

I too was once like you, stacking lethality on Garen, waiting in bushes to smite them like the Noxian scum they are. But I've grown past that. I realize now that Garen's greatest strength is his unrelenting nature. So I build around that. I know longer lie in wait, I charge toward my enemies like an unstoppable fidget spinner of pure justice. This is usually an ideal full build for me:

> [{quoted}](name=Big Lincoln,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=XfVHkhEU,comment-id=000000020000,timestamp=2017-07-16T00:46:40.938+0000)

> 
> rn im thinking {{item:3071}} {{item:3147}} {{item:3075}} {{item:3065}} {{item:3047}} {{item:3083}}

i think {{item:3742}} is a must buy on him. just to chase, flank and roam into other lanes. a fully charged dead mans also adds a 100 damage to your q.

ignore the new thornmail. the completed thing is not worth its gold. all you need is {{item:3076}} into specific matchups. i usually sell it later for a bigger item.

like something like this is already a really well rounded build 

{{item:1001}} {{item:3147}} {{item:3742}} {{item:3053}} {{item:3065}} {{item:3071}} 

almost  4k health, close to 300 ad, some extra resistances, mobility and utility.

with {{item:3071}} as third or 4th item depending on the enemy teamcomp.

just going into midgame with {{item:3147}} {{item:3742}} is really good to make plays all aroud the map. unless the enemy has an obscenely fed mage, the health off dead mans, and your scaling mr + mr from courage is enough to carry you through skirmishes.

what runes do you usually take

rn i'm running lethality, scaling hp, scaling mr. since im getting so much armor from W passive and items already the high amount of HP into the late game feels gr8. might swap for scaling armor, though, which would make a raw health item like sterak feel better

im thinking about swapping the blues for cdr, since this build delays cleaver.

but the entire point of doing this, is to stack enough burst that you dont need more than one rotation. ill experiment a bit.

wb masteries

i've been liking tld on him for assassinating folk, stormraider's is nice too

0/18/12 feels better for the added defense

situational for me.

0/18/12 with stormraider into champions and teams that are squishy enough to reliably proc it. matchups like {{champion:23}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:41}} and the like.

12/0/18 against beefier matchups like lets say {{champion:58}} {{champion:54}} etc.


ive seen some garen mains go into fervor of battle combined with a {{item:3022}} rush, which i thought is intersting. might try that aswell.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jhx-pnaVbQw 

hashinshin made a really nice video about garen, good listen imo.

> [{quoted}](name=Big Lincoln,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=XfVHkhEU,comment-id=0000000200000000000000000000,timestamp=2017-07-16T01:09:13.946+0000)

> wb masteries

> 
> 0/18/12 feels better for the added defense

i feel like the stormraider build would really synergize incredibly well with {{item:3147}} 

just think of how lane trades would look like. you walk into a bush to get the passive, look for a short and hard trade with duskblades added damage to your q, then with the stormraider proc speed back into a bush to reactivate duskblades passive. if your enemy follows you to extend the trade, he eats the damage twice.

possibly more depending how you can kite out of vision through the 3 bushes in top lane.

if he doesnt follow you, you look to trade again asap.

and midgame and lategame its pretty much the same. you deal a lot of burst and should be able to proc stormraider reliably on squishies. its a great anti kite tool. something garen cant have enough of.

i remember there was a moment, when i got caught between 3 people a couple month ago. and i ulted the enemy hecarim who was the villain and managed to kill him. with the stormraider surge and my q, i was able to run out so fast, that the other 2 guys lost track of me around corners and i got out of range alive before they could catch up.

really undervalued keystone.

it is. it's ironic that the people who enjoy the assassin keystone the most are immobile bruisers, and almost all of them now gravitate towards it instead of their own intended tree (resolve)

hopes for an anti-kite juggernaut keystone in season 8 since they're dead-set on ruining their game again with shit like meteor

> [{quoted}](name=Big Lincoln,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=XfVHkhEU,comment-id=000000020000000000000000000000010000,timestamp=2017-07-16T01:44:51.110+0000)

i dont feel like meteor is going to be too much of an issue in many cases.

looks like a slow thunderlords than you can dodge. and the travel time is fixed, so its not going to be faster in melee range.

they said the current keystones will make it back next season. considering that theyre even beefed up from their current state (grasp affects multiple enemy champions in a certain range to you and heals you for more than now), i wonder what stormraider is going to look like.

i dislike it for its gimmicky nature

would rather this sort of stuff be on items or champ kits and not on free things. never liked keystones much
This makes me want to pick up Garen again after all these years. I missed the big guy :(

Thats what makes him reliable, and the reason why I like playing as him alot.
